title: Donald Trump Sues the BBC Over a TV Show
summary: Donald Trump, a former US President, is suing the BBC, a big TV company, because he says they changed his speech in a documentary. The documentary was about Trump and aired before an election. In the show, they edited parts of his speech together to make it sound different. Trump is asking for a lot of money, $5 billion, in a court in Florida. The BBC said sorry for the edit but does not agree that they did anything wrong to deserve a lawsuit. They will fight the case in court. This happened after a newspaper found out about the edit from a secret memo, and two BBC bosses quit because of it. Trump's lawyers sent a letter asking for things like an apology and money, but the BBC only said sorry and won't pay.

background_read: Donald Trump was the President of the United States from 2017 to 2021. The BBC is a well-known British broadcasting company that makes TV shows and news. A lawsuit is when people go to court to solve a disagreement. An edit in TV means cutting and putting parts together, which can change how something looks or sounds. This case is about whether changing a speech in a documentary is wrong and if it hurts someone's reputation.
Article_Structure: WHO: Donald Trump, a former US President, and the BBC, a British TV company.
WHAT: Trump is suing the BBC for changing his speech in a documentary, asking for $5 billion.
WHERE: The lawsuit was filed in Florida, USA.
WHY: Trump says the edit made him look bad, but the BBC apologized and disagrees, so they are going to court.

perspectives.description: He believes the BBC intentionally changed his speech to harm him and wants money and an apology.
They say the edit was a mistake, apologized, but don't think it's defamation and will defend in court.
